author: vortex6066
full_text:
Thanks Frank for the clarification.
I havent played with TRF chips for years, but I remember they were dead silent in between stations, which has to be good. I seem to remember the selectivity wasnt too good, but I may have had too much gain happening.
Presently been playing with a head-less 12-469, which seems quite good and also quiet in between stations. I guess you rate the MK484 better due to it having no mixer noise?
I found an article on the ZN414, and thought I should share it, as its got a new slant on RF Gain control, by tapping down the AGC feedback via a pot. It should allow much greater control of the chips response to strong signals. The cct in question is shown down the page here ....
http://cool386.tripod.com/zn414/zn414.html
regards from "down under" in NZ,
JEFF
